snippet: Shrimp farmers are trying to meet the growing demand for their product, but in an environmentally responsible way.
abstract: Growing number of small high-tech shrimp farmers in America are trying to meet the growing demand, without ravaging the environment, using harmful chemicals or depending on overseas suppliers accused of labor rights violations; their shrimp mature in fiberglass tanks; it is most-consumed seafood per capital in United States, with 3.8 pounds per American in 2012.
lead_paragraph: Shrimp farmers are trying to meet the growing demand for their product, but in an environmentally responsible way.

headline.seo: With Wild Stocks of Shrimp Dwindling, Tank Farming Is on the Rise
headline.main: Shrimp’s New Path to the Plate
headline.print_headline: Shrimp’s New Path to the Plate
